author: nicobilinkis
content: hey guys, Nico here at ETHMexicoCity. I'm looking for a ETH2 API that has a suscription/endpoint to get all the orphaned blocks. anyone that could help out with that?

author: ajsutton
content: There isn't a service that provides that as far as I know.  You can tell Teku to retain orphaned blocks rather than pruning but you'd have to have been online at the time to collect them.

author: nicobilinkis
content: I can gather all the new blocks, but I'm not sure if there is an easy way to identify which of those blocks were actually orphaned. Any ideas, <@340345049063882753>?

author: ajsutton
content: `/eth/v1/beacon/headers` can list all headers at a specific slot (there may be more than one block per slot in the case of forks or slashable offenses) and it includes a flag to indicate whether each one is canonical or not.

author: nicobilinkis
content: That's great. Do you have an example of an actual block that was orphaned on Goerli?
